keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back, died at age 36 after being detained by Oakland police during an investigation into a break-in.
Martin was reportedly involved in a brief struggle with officers, after which he became unresponsive and later died in hospital.
The cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is scheduled.
Martin played for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers from 2012 to 2017 and briefly with the Oakland Raiders, accumulating 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns.
He was selected as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers history and earned Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro honors in 2012 and 2015.
His death has sparked public concern about police interactions with individuals during arrests, especially those with criminal or property-related investigations.
The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee have expressed condolences, acknowledging Martin’s contributions to the community and the NFL.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, known for his standout career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at 36 after being detained by Oakland police during an investigation into a home break-in. A brief struggle with officers occurred, after which he became unresponsive and later died in a hospital. The cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is pending. Martin had a successful career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, earning Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors. The incident has prompted public concern about police interactions with individuals during arrests, and officials from both the Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee have expressed condolences to his family.
title: Former NFL player Doug Martin died after struggling with officers while being detained
